caption.center: STATE of Maine v. Robert IFILL.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Appeal from Superior Court Kennebec County.
opinion.attorneys:
David W. Crook, Dist. Atty., William Baghdoyan, Asst. Dist. Atty., Augusta, for plaintiff.
Mark S. Kierstead, Augusta, for defendant.
opinion.panel: Before McKUSICK, C.J., and NICHOLS, ROBERTS, GLASSMAN and SCOLNIK, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
MEMORANDUM OF DECISION.
After a jury-waived trial in the Superior Court, Kennebec County, the defendant was convicted of the criminal violation of operation of a motor vehicle while under the influence of intoxicating liquor, 29 M.R.S.A. ยง 1312-B (Supp. 1984-1985). The defendant raises several constitutional issues, all related to the State's determination to proceed against him criminally under29 M.R.S.A. ยง 1312-B rather than civilly under29 M.R.S.A. ยง 1312-C. In light of our holding in State v. Freeman,487 A.2d 1175 (Me. 1985), that section 1312-C is unconstitutional, we need not consider the issues raised by the defendant and express no opinion thereon. State v. Brown, 488 A.2d 939, 941 (Me. 1985).
The entry is:
Judgment affirmed.
All concurring.
Page 599
